comments:
When I try to record a test using Internet Explorer I get an error that says that the current proxy configuration is not supported. This is ok, but if i don't close the error dialog a get many errors like the following in my log file.

Notice that i also filed bug #121068, but I guess this is a different case.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.StringTokenizer.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.StringTokenizer.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.recorder.local.appadapters.InternetExplorerAdapter.parseInitInfo(InternetExplorerAdapter.java:374)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.recorder.local.appadapters.InternetExplorerAdapter.init(InternetExplorerAdapter.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.recorder.local.RecorderClient.startApplication(RecorderClient.java:759)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.recorder.local.RecorderClient.startRecording(RecorderClient.java:514)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.recorder.local.RecorderClient.run(RecorderClient.java:427)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.recorder.Recorder.Record(Recorder.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.recorder.ui.RecorderClientUI$1.run(RecorderClientUI.java:53)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

The real problem is that when this condition is detected, the recorder should stop and not allow the recording to proceed.  That was how it was done in 3.3.  

I will modify the http recorder to stop completely when this condition is detected.
Set target to 4.2i1. Also increased severity to major.
Fixed this problem.  We now stop the recording if a configuration problem (of any kind) is detected.

Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.
